name: Mohamed Al-Malahy
bio: Mohamed is a Chartered Accountant (License No. 43100) and has been an ACCA member since 2013. He is also a member of the Egyptian Society of Certified Accountants and Auditors (ESCA) with over 20 years of experience in auditing, accounting, and financial management. Mohamed is set to become a Fellow of ACCA in 2025. He previously led Zaino CPA's assurance services, overseeing audits, agreed-upon procedures, bookkeeping, and financial advisory. Mohamed also served as CFO for two companies in Saudi Arabia from 2014 to 2020, contributing to strategic decision-making as part of the executive team. Earlier in his career he progressed through roles at Ernst & Young from 2004 to 2014, covering sectors such as manufacturing, healthcare, real estate, telecom, and finance.

name: Ahmed Awad
bio: Ahmed is a seasoned financial executive who most recently served as the CFO for HungerStation, a leading member of the Delivery Hero Group listed on the Berlin Stock Exchange. With over 20 years of experience, his expertise spans external audit, taxation, corporate finance, internal audit, and business advisory across e-commerce, manufacturing, hospitality, real estate, contracting, and media. He began his career at Ernst & Young in Cairo and Riyadh before moving into leadership roles including Group Internal Audit Manager at Rajhi Invest in Saudi Arabia and senior finance positions at Orbit Showtime Network. Ahmed has partnered with major clients such as CIB, Suez Cement, Saudi Chemical, Abu Nayyan Holding, and Bank Audi.

name: Sayed Sabbaq
bio: Sayed Sabbaq is a Chartered Accountant (License No. 33779) as well as a member of the Egyptian Tax Society, the Egyptian Society for Public Finance and Taxes, and the Egyptian Society of Certified Accountants and Auditors. With more than 15 years of experience in auditing, accounting, and financial services, he specializes in tax services and dispute resolution across income and indirect taxes. His advisory work covers company formation in Egypt, mergers and acquisitions, restructuring, capital adjustments, and corporate governance processes, along with expatriate work permits, corporate liquidations, and contracting insurance services.

name: Ms. Ola Raafat
bio: Ola has 25 years of experience across assurance and consulting engagements, with deep specialization in internal audit for multinational projects. She excels at building and guiding diverse teams and brings extensive knowledge of ERM frameworks, COSO, IFRS, US GAAP, EAAS, SOX, and other governance standards. Ola has restructured executive departments and boards, developed risk-based annual audit plans, and led compliance and fraud investigations for organizations throughout Egypt.

name: Mohamed Magdy
bio: Mohamed is a Chartered Accountant (License No. 43100) and an ACCA member since 2013 with extensive expertise in taxation and IFRS. He is also part of the Egyptian Society of Certified Accountants and Auditors and brings more than 20 years in auditing, accounting, and financial management. Mohamed led Zaino CPA's assurance and tax services, managing audits, agreed-upon procedures, bookkeeping, and financial advisory assignments. He previously served as CFO for two Saudi companies between 2014 and 2020, supporting executive decisions, and earlier advanced to Audit Manager at Ernst & Young after joining the firm in 2004.

name: Ragab Gomaa
bio: Ragab is a member of the Egyptian Society of Accountants and Auditors and holds the ACCA Diploma in International Financial Reporting Standards. He has served as an Audit Manager at RSM International, Baker Tilly, and Roedl, leading high-performing teams across statutory audits, agreed-upon procedures, bookkeeping, and financial advisory services. His sector experience includes manufacturing, hospitality, nonprofits, brokerage, telecommunications, and information technology.

name: Saad Dawood
bio: Saad Dawood brings more than 20 years of experience in information technology and cybersecurity. He holds a computer science degree from a Canadian university and has collaborated with international vendors on large-scale digital security projects. Saad is known for combining technical expertise with practical leadership, building teams that deliver resilient cybersecurity programs while navigating the evolving threat landscape.
